citeinfo.title: Total overburden contours of the Zone 1 coal bed in Northeast Texas

serinfo.sername: AAPG Discovery Series/AAPG Studies in Geology

citeinfo.title: Geologic Assessment of Coal in the Gulf of Mexico Coastal Plain, U.S.A.

serinfo.sername: AAPG Discovery Series/AAPG Studies in Geology

descript.abstract: This data set is a polygon coverage of the cumulative overburden of Zone 1, in feet, over extent of the Zone 1 coal and its horizon (stratigraphic equivalent) in Northeast Texas only. The coverage was produced by gridding more than 150 public and confidential point- source data from the National Coal Resources Data System (NCRDS) of the USGS, using EarthVision (Version 4.0.2) software, subsequently contoured into 6-inch intervals, and imported to ARC/INFO. The 'overburden' item for each polygon reflects a value in feet halfway between the bounding contour lines. This value represents results of gridding which averages point values within cells, therefore, public point data may not always match values represented in the overburden data layer.
descript.purpose: This data set was used in the National Coal Resource Assessment Program in the regional evaluation of resources for the coal Zone 1 in the Gulf Coast region. The data set is useful for regional studies- not applicable to local scales.

idinfo.datacred: The stratigraphic data stored in the NCRDS has been submitted by State Geological Surveys and USGS scientists since its inception in the middle 1970's through state cooperative programs. The data for the zone 1 coal bed was used with the permission and through the cooperation of coal geologists (primary contacts listed) at the State of Texas Bureau of Economic Geology and the State of Texas Railroad Commission
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: The range of overburden values in the point-source information was -132 to 325 feet. The resultant range of the gridded surface was 0-457 feet; extrapolation was used over the x,y extent. The average absolute Z-error of the grid was 0.89 percent of the range.

dataqual.complete: Input points were irregularly distributed over the spatial extent of the study, therefore areas of sparse data will not reflect ground truth. Zone 1 cumulative coal overburden were selected by name from the stratigraphic data base stored in StratiFact, a relational data base manager in use by the USGS National Coal Assessment. The original data submitted to NCRDS may not have had the Zone identified, a task performed within StratiFact by examining data in cross sections. Data used were selected by geologist from the database.

srcinfo.srccitea: NCRDS- National Coal Resources Data System;BEG-Bureau of Economic Geology; RRC-Railroad Commission

procstep.procdesc: Zone 1 data from NCRDS printed and verified against original data sources where possible. New data collected from the BEG and the RRC, and entered into NCRDS.
Corrections made to NCRDS (including the new BEG and RRC data) in StratiFact.
Editing and correlation of individual data bases in StratiFact to eliminate data coding differences between data sets.

Editing of overburden and further addition and refinement of data values to place in StratiFact data bases. The data were filtered in StratiFact and filtered in EarthVision (v.4.0.2) in geographic coordinates. The data are gridded and grid parameters used were a default 1867 x 1047 grid, X range -95.9899 to -94.8223, Y range 32.5812 to 33.1528, extrapolation of values over specified x,y extent plus 5%. Contour intervals at irregular intervals at 0-1.5 ft,1.5-2.5 ft, 2.5-5 ft, 5-10 ft, 10-20 ft, 20-30 ft. to follow USGS Circular 891
Grid was contoured in EarthVision into 0.5-foot intervals, using 0 to 30 feet as limits. Contour file was graphically edited in EarthVision to fit the geology of the area.

Import of contours to ARC/INFO for the entire area, using conversion ARC/INFO AML provided by Illinois State Geological Survey, and rectangular area ARC coverage (box) to enclose polygons. Polygons graphically labeled in ARC/EDIT using midpoint value for upper and lower bounding contours. The 0, 0.75, 2, 3.75, 7.5, 15, 25 (ft).

New attribute item "overburden" added and calculated from the polygon value. Added item for overburden category and populated it by graphically selecting desired polygons by overburden and calculating the category value.
Arc/Info coverages were projected to geographic coordinates, converted to shape Arc/View shape files and imported into Arc/View.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: average overburden value of bounding contour lines
category label for coal bed overburden
